content: Legislative Assembly of Singapore The **1st Legislative Assembly of Singapore** was a meeting of the [Legislative Assembly of Singapore](/wiki/Legislative_Assembly_of_Singapore) from 22 April 1955 until 31 March 1959. ## Officeholders - [**Speaker**](/wiki/Speaker_of_the_Parliament_of_Singapore)**:** [Sir George Oehlers](/wiki/George_Oehlers) - **[Deputy Speaker](/wiki/Speaker_of_the_Parliament_of_Singapore#List_of_deputy_speakers):** Richard Chuan Hoe Lim ([LF](/wiki/Labour_Front), later [MCA](/wiki/Malaysian_Chinese_Association)) - **[Chief Secretary](/wiki/Chief_Secretary_of_Singapore):** - [William Goode](/wiki/William_Goode_(colonial_administrator)) ([IND](/wiki/Independent_politician)) until 9 December 1957 - [Edgeworth David](/wiki/Edgeworth_David_(colonial_administrator)) ([IND](/wiki/Independent_politician)) from 29 January 1958 - **[Chief Minister](/wiki/Chief_Minister_of_Singapore):** - [David Marshall](/wiki/David_Marshall_(Singaporean_politician)) ([LF](/wiki/Labour_Front)) until 7 June 1956 - [Lim Yew Hock](/wiki/Lim_Yew_Hock) ([LF](/wiki/Labour_Front), later [SPA](/wiki/Singapore_People%27s_Alliance)) from 7 June 1956 - **[Attorney General](/wiki/Attorney_General_of_Singapore):** - [John Davies](/wiki/John_Davies_(judge)) ([IND](/wiki/Independent_politician)) until 5 September 1955 - [Charles Harris Butterfield](/wiki/Charles_Harris_Butterfield) ([IND](/wiki/Independent_politician)) from 6 September 1955 until 1 July 1957 - [Ernest Pattison Shanks](/wiki/Ernest_Pattison_Shanks), ([IND](/wiki/Independent_politician)) from 2 July 1957 - **[Financial Secretary](/wiki/Financial_Secretary_of_Singapore):** - [Thomas Hart](/wiki/Thomas_Hart_(civil_servant)) ([IND](/wiki/Independent_politician)) - **[Leader of the Opposition](/wiki/Leader_of_the_Opposition_(Singapore)):** [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)) ##
